alert.note: Alert for Carver; McLeod; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 10:37PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wright, eastern McLeod and western Carver Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1037 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Dassel, or 8 miles northeast of Hutchinson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cokato and Silver Lake around 1040 PM CDT. Winsted and Howard Lake around 1050 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Montrose, Watertown, Delano and Rockford. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 117 and 140. U.S. Highway 212 between mile markers 114 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central Minnesota.
